title: Katie Taylor Beats Serrano Again, Retains Title at Historic MSG Bout
snippets: Ireland's Katie Taylor beats Amanda Serrano for the third time in their epic trilogy, winning their bout at New York's Madison Square Garden.
Katie Taylor outpointed Amanda Serrano once again to retain her undisputed junior welterweight title.

This historic bout was part of an all-women’s card, marking a significant event in boxing history. Taylor's win concludes their trilogy with a clean sweep of victories against Serrano.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful context about the progression of women's boxing, highlighting a historic event. It does not, however, delve into systemic issues or offer actionable insights for the reader. The focus is more on the individual achievement of Katie Taylor.

title: Air India Crash Report: No Fault Found in Boeing, Focus on Pilots' Actions
snippets: Indian investigators determined the Boeing 787 Dreamliner was properly configured and lifted off normally. But three seconds after takeoff, the engines' fuel switches were cut off.
Preliminary investigation does not apportion blame for Boeing 787 crash that killed 260 people in June.
Preliminary findings recommend ‘no actions’ against Boeing or GE Aerospace over incident

Early investigation into accident in Ahmedabad in June also contains details of pilots discussing the switches

Fuel to both engines of the Air India plane that cr
A focus on the Boeing 787’s fuel switches in a preliminary assessment raised questions about the pilots’ actions, but much is still unknown about Flight 171.
titles: Preliminary report says fuel switches were cut off before Air India Boeing 787 crash
Fuel switches cut off just before deadly Air India crash, early report says

Air India Plane Crash Report Says Fuel to Engines Was Cut Off
summary: Indian investigators' preliminary report on the Air India crash in Ahmedabad in June, which resulted in 260 deaths, reveals that the Boeing 787 Dreamliner was correctly configured for takeoff. However, seconds after takeoff, the plane's engines' fuel switches were cut off. Despite detailing this critical incident, the investigation does not blame Boeing or GE Aerospace and recommends no actions against them. The report also mentions discussions between pilots regarding the switches, focusing attention on their actions during the incident.
constructiveness_reason: The story provides useful information about the preliminary findings of the crash investigation. It increases awareness about the incident and the systems involved in aviation safety. However, it lacks progress or actionable insights as it does not suggest any solutions or improvements to prevent similar incidents in the future.

title: Judge Halts ICE, Border Patrol Stops in 7 CA Counties Amid Profiling Claims
snippets: Civil rights groups alleged that ICE and Border Patrol agents are rounding people up based on their race, and denying them access to lawyers. A federal judge said there's  evidence what they're doing is illegal.

titles: Federal judge orders stop to indiscriminate immigration raids in Los Angeles

summary: A federal judge has temporarily blocked ICE and Border Patrol from conducting indiscriminate immigration stops and arrests in seven California counties, including Los Angeles. This decision came after civil rights groups accused the agencies of racially profiling and denying individuals access to lawyers, with the judge finding evidence of potentially illegal practices. The lawsuit claimed the government was systematically targeting people based on their skin color.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides useful information about a legal decision that impacts immigration practices, potentially affecting many people's lives. It also raises awareness about issues of racial profiling and access to legal representation, important social justice topics. However, it doesn't report on any solutions or improvements to the problem, hence the score is not higher.

title: Court Nullifies 9/11 Mastermind's Plea Deal, Keeps Death Penalty Option
snippets: A civilian court of appeals says ex-Pentagon chief Lloyd Austin 'had full legal authority' to withdraw plea agreement.

A divided federal appeals court has scrapped an agreement that would have allowed the alleged September 11 mastermind Khalid Sheikh Mohammed to plead guilty in a deal sparing him the risk of execution.
The court found that Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III had the authority to invalidate a contract reached between the accused mastermind and a Pentagon official.

WASHINGTON (AP) — A divided federal appeals court on Friday threw out an agreement that would have allowed accused Sept. 11 mastermind Khalid Sheikh Mohammed to plead guilty in a deal sparing him the risk of execution for al-Qaida’s 2001 attacks. The decision by a panel of the federal appeals court
titles: US court nixes guilty plea for alleged 9/11 attacks mastermind
US: Court throws out plea deal for alleged 9/11 mastermind
Appeals Court Overturns Plea Deal in 9/11 Case
Appeals court throws out plea deal for alleged mastermind of Sept. 11 attacks
summary: A federal appeals court has overturned an agreement that would have allowed Khalid Sheikh Mohammed, the accused mastermind behind the September 11 attacks, to plead guilty while avoiding the death penalty. The court ruled that Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III had the legal authority to nullify the plea deal previously reached with a Pentagon official. This decision maintains the possibility of execution for Mohammed.
constructiveness_reason: This story offers basic awareness about the court's decision regarding the 9/11 mastermind's plea deal. It provides some insight into the legal proceedings related to high-profile terrorism cases. However, it does not provide actionable insights, solutions, or a deeper understanding of the broader implications of this decision.

title: 798 Dead in Gaza Aid Access Attempts, GHF Questions Figures
snippets: The OHCHR released figures that showed at least 798 people have been killed trying to access aid in the Gaza Strip over the past 10 weeks. The much-maligned GHF have cast doubt on the veracity of the numbers.

title: First Ancient Egyptian Genome Sequenced, Reveals 4,800-Year-Old Secrets
titles: Scientists Sequence First Genome From Ancient Egypt, Revealing 4,800-Year-Old Secrets
summary: Scientists have successfully sequenced the first genome from Ancient Egypt, unlocking secrets from 4,800 years ago. This groundbreaking research provides new insights into the genetic makeup and ancestry of the ancient Egyptians, offering a deeper understanding of their history and connections to other regions. The study focused on remains found near the Step Pyramid at Saqqara, dating back to Egypt's Old Kingdom period. This achievement marks a significant advancement in the field of archaeogenetics.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it reports on a significant advancement in the field of archaeogenetics. It provides readers with a deeper understanding of the genetic makeup and history of ancient Egyptians, offering actionable insights for researchers in related fields. It also highlights a solution to a long-standing problem in the field.
